Cells

Cells hold property values. That value can be a constant (e.g. 50 or "red") or it can be a constraint (e.g. x+1 or Math.sqrt(y)) that recalculates its value based on a formula that uses the properties of this or other objects.

The example below has three cells for the fields x, y, and change_me. Note that the cell is the formulat that computes the value (1+2+3 for x), not its current value (6 for x)

To change a cell's value, click it and type a new value. Press [enter] to confirm or [esc] to cancel.

try changing the value of change_me in the example below to:

  • A number (e.g. 10)
  • A string (e.g. "red")
  • A constraint (e.g. 2*y)
  • A function call (e.g. Math.sqrt(y))
  • An array (e.g. [5, 6, 7])

You can use [ctrl]+z and [ctrl]+[shift]+z to undo and redo any changes you make to your program.
